Photosynthesis is the sum of a series of complex metabolic reactions. It is the basis for the survival of the biological community and the material and energy basis for the growth and development of plants
26, 45 . Photosynthetic capacity plays an important role in plant yield
27, 28 . S. trilobata is one of the fast-growing invasive plants in South China. In the invaded area, S. trilobata has a large leaf area, leaf biomass and total biomass per plant were much higher than those of native species, S. calendulacea (Fig.Â 1A,D,E). This may be attributed to the fact that the photosynthetic capacity of S. trilobata is stronger than that of S. calendulacea. Thus, we analyzed the difference in the photosynthetic capacity of S. trilobata and its native plants by combined analysis of the physiological ecology and transcriptome. This could better explain the molecular mechanism underlying invasion by this species.
